meanings.definition: Printed material, such as brochures or flyers, used for promotional purposes.
meanings.sent1: The company handed out colorful bumph at the event to attract customers.
meanings.sent2: I picked up some interesting bumph about the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent3: The bumph for the new movie made it seem like a must-watch.
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with bumph, creating a vibrant atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The bumph for the charity event was so eye-catching that everyone wanted to attend.

meanings.definition: Unnecessary or excessive paperwork or red tape.
meanings.sent1: Dealing with all this bumph is slowing down the project.
meanings.sent2: I wish we could get rid of all this unnecessary bumph.
meanings.sent3: The amount of bumph required for the application was ridiculous.
meanings.sent4: The bumph piled up on his desk, making it hard to find anything.
meanings.sent5: The bumph from the government was overwhelming and confusing.

meanings.definition: To pad or stuff with material to give it shape or fullness.
meanings.sent1: She decided to bumph up the pillow for extra comfort.
meanings.sent2: I need to bumph this costume to make it look more realistic.
meanings.sent3: He bumphed the package with extra padding to protect the fragile item.
meanings.sent4: The chef bumphed the omelette with cheese for a delicious twist.
meanings.sent5: The tailor bumphed the dress to give it a more elegant silhouette.
